title: Frustum
summary: In geometry, a frustum (Latin for 'morsel');[lower-alpha 1] PLÂ frusta or frustums) is the portion of a solid (normally a pyramid or a cone) that lies between two parallel planes cutting this solid. In the case of a pyramid, the base faces are polygonal, the side faces are trapezoidal. A right frustum is a right pyramid or a right cone truncated perpendicularly to its axis;[3] otherwise, it is an oblique frustum.
